Description: Create routes with app/routes/ file convention
Do: Use flat routes or folder-based routing convention
Don't: Manually define all routes in a config file
Code Bad: routes: [{ path: '/blog/:slug', component: BlogPost }]

Description: Leverage nested layouts with <Outlet/>
Do: Create parent routes with shared UI and child routes below
Don't: Duplicate shared UI (nav/sidebar) in every route
Code Bad: Copy-paste sidebar in every route component

Description: Type route params with TypeScript generics
Do: Define param types and validate in loader
Don't: Cast params to string without validation
Code Bad: const slug = params.slug as string // might be undefined

Description: Load data on the server with loader functions
Do: Export loader function — runs server-side before render
Don't: Fetch data in useEffect — causes waterfall and loading states
Code Good: export async function loader({ params }: Route.LoaderArgs) { return db.getPost(params.slug) }
Code Bad: useEffect(() => fetch('/api/post/' + slug), [slug])

Description: Access loader data with type-safe hook
Do: Destructure typed data from useLoaderData
Don't: Manually type-cast loader data
Code Bad: const data = useLoaderData() as any

Description: Stream slow data with defer() and <Suspense>
Do: Defer non-critical data and show skeleton while loading
Don't: Block entire page render waiting for slowest API call
Code Good: return defer({ post: getPost(slug), comments: getComments(slug) }); <Suspense fallback={<Skeleton/>}><Await resolve={comments}/></Suspense>
Code Bad: await both getPost and getComments before any render

Description: Handle form submissions with action functions
Do: Export action function for POST/PUT/DELETE operations
Don't: Handle mutations in client-side event handlers
Code Good: export async function action({ request }: Route.ActionArgs) { const formData = await request.formData(); ... }
Code Bad: onClick={() => fetch('/api/post', { method: 'POST' })}

Description: Use Remix <Form> for progressive enhancement
Do: Use <Form> instead of <form> for automatic revalidation
Don't: Use <form> with onSubmit handlers for all mutations
Code Bad: <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}> with manual fetch

Description: Use useFetcher for mutations without navigation
Do: Use fetcher.Form for like/delete/toggle that shouldn't navigate
Don't: Use full <Form> for simple toggle actions causing page scroll
Code Bad: <Form method='post'> for like button — full page navigation

Description: Show expected result before server confirms
Do: Use useFetcher.formData to show optimistic state immediately
Don't: Wait for server round-trip before updating UI
Code Bad: Spinner on every button click until server responds

Description: Export ErrorBoundary in route modules for error recovery
Do: Use route-level ErrorBoundary for granular error handling
Don't: Let errors bubble to root — crashes entire app
Code Bad: No ErrorBoundary — one error crashes full page

Description: Throw Response objects for HTTP error handling
Do: Throw new Response() for 404/403/500 in loaders
Don't: Return error objects — loses HTTP semantics
Code Bad: return { error: 'Not found' } // loses HTTP status

Description: Forms work without JavaScript
Do: Ensure forms submit data via native HTML — JS enhances UX
Don't: Build forms that require JS to function at all
Code Good: <Form method='post'> with name attributes on all inputs
Code Bad: onClick handler required to submit — broken without JS

Description: Show loading state during form navigation
Do: Use useNavigation().state to indicate pending submissions
Don't: No feedback during form submission — user clicks multiple times
Code Bad: <button>Save</button> with no pending state

Description: Display server validation errors in the form
Do: Return errors from action and display with useActionData
Don't: Client-only validation — server errors lost
Code Bad: try/catch in onClick with no server-side validation

Description: Define page meta tags with meta() export
Do: Export meta function for dynamic title/description/OG tags
Don't: Hardcode same <title> on every page
Code Good: export function meta({ data }: Route.MetaArgs) { return [{ title: data.post.title }] }
Code Bad: <title>My App</title> hardcoded in root

Description: Control cache headers per route
Do: Export headers function for cache control strategy
Don't: No cache headers — everything fetches fresh
Code Bad: No caching strategy — every request hits server

Description: Use cookie-based sessions with createCookieSessionStorage
Do: Use built-in session management for auth state
Don't: Store auth tokens in localStorage — XSS vulnerable
Code Good: const { getSession } = createCookieSessionStorage({ cookie: { httpOnly: true, secure: true } })
Code Bad: localStorage.setItem('token', jwt) // XSS vulnerable

Description: Create API endpoints with resource routes (no UI)
Do: Export only loader/action without default export for JSON APIs
Don't: Build separate API server for simple endpoints
Code Good: export async function loader() { return Response.json(data) }
Code Bad: Separate Express server for 2 JSON endpoints

Description: Use <Link prefetch='intent'> for faster navigation
Do: Set prefetch='intent' to prefetch on hover/focus
Don't: No prefetching — every navigation requires fresh load
Code Bad: <Link to='/blog'>Blog</Link> without prefetch

Description: Lazy load heavy route modules to reduce initial bundle
Do: Use lazy() for routes not needed on initial page load
Don't: Load all routes eagerly in route config
Code Bad: import AdminRoute from './routes/admin' // in main bundle

Description: Scope styles with CSS Modules or use Tailwind
Do: Use CSS Modules for scoped styles or Tailwind for utility-first
Don't: Global CSS for everything — selector conflicts
Code Good: .module.css with scoped class names or Tailwind utilities
Code Bad: Global styles.css with generic selectors

Description: Ensure forms use proper HTML semantics
Do: Use <label> <fieldset> <legend> in form routes
Don't: Skip labels — rely on placeholder text
Code Bad: <input placeholder='Email'/> with no label

Description: Theme with CSS custom properties and server-side cookie
Do: Set theme in cookie via action to prevent flash on SSR
Don't: Client-only theme with flash on SSR pages
Code Good: Theme cookie set in action → read in root loader → class on <html>
Code Bad: useEffect to set theme — flash on SSR hydration

Description: Use loader streaming for AI-generated content
Do: Stream AI responses through defer and Suspense boundaries
Don't: Wait for full AI response before showing anything
Code Bad: const content = await ai.generate(prompt); return { content }

Description: Load analytics only after user consent
Do: Use action to set consent cookie then conditionally load scripts
Don't: Pre-load tracking scripts before consent
Code Good: if (consent.analytics) { loadGA() } // in root loader check
Code Bad: <script src='gtag.js'> in root.tsx head always

Description: Test routes with @testing-library/react and createMemoryRouter
Do: Test user-facing behavior with Testing Library
Don't: Test internal component state and implementation details
Code Good: render with createMemoryRouter → test visible output
Code Bad: Directly test loader functions without rendering

Description: Select appropriate deployment adapter
Do: Use Vercel/Netlify/Node adapter matching deploy target
Don't: Deploy without adapter — breaks SSR
Code Bad: Generic build output to Vercel without adapter config
